result.execSummary:
The defendant Rodrigo S. Hernandez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*   Pay fine of $500 and court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*   Submit to a DNA sample and pay surcharge.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

timeConds.notes:
Huber and Work Crew allowed.
Credit for 3 days.
Unless work crew is expressly prohibited by the Court, an inmate serving time as a condition of probation is eligible for work crew and may receive a credit of one day for every 3 days of work performed.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rodrigo S. Hernandez

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State. Defendant, Rodrigo S. Hernandez, appeared with Attorney John E. German.  Clerk: PT
Sentencing arguments made.  Sentence is withheld and DE is placed on probation for 1 year with conditions.  As a condition court imposes 30 days in the KCJ commencing on 10/24/15 at 8:00 AM.  Credit for 3 days.  Huber & Work Crew privileges are authorized.  DE is ordered to submit to a DNA sample and notice is given.  Court imposes a fine of $500 plus costs & DNA surcharge to be paid during supervision.  Any unpaid financial obligations that remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  Appeal Rights given.
Upon further review of calendar Atty German states he will not be available afternoon of 9/16 so Sentencing will be on 10/8/15 at 2:00 PM and confirmed with Atty German
Sentencing date of 9/16 at 3:30 PM confirmed with Atty German
Sentencing rescheduled from 9/17/15 at 2:30 PM to 9/16/15 at 3:30 PM due to overlap with Behavioral Court and pending confirmation from Atty German.

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State. Defendant, Rodrigo S. Hernandez, appeared with Attorney John E. German.  Clerk: PT
Case is resolved.  State moves to dismiss the on or near park enhancer.  DE pleads Guilty without the park enhancer; found guilty by the court.  PSI ordered for Sentencing on 9/17/15 at 2:30 PM.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State. Defendant, Rodrigo S. Hernandez, appeared with Attorney John E. German.  Clerk: PT
Atty German states an offer was received today and case is resolved, but requests a new date for a plea; no objection by the State.  Plea Hearing on 8/6/15 at 10:30 AM.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State. Defendant, Rodrigo S. Hernandez, appeared with Attorney John E. German.  Clerk: PT
Atty German states he will be meeting with DE today and requests one more adjournment; no objection by the State.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 9, 2015 at 08:40 am.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State. Def. appeared in court with Atty. John German. Clerk LE.   Plea offer placed on the record by the State.  Prelim. waived, probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 8. Information filed, plea of not guilty. Judicial pretrial on 6-19-15 @ 9:00am. Bond continued.

143pm
  Special Prosecutor Attorney Jerrold Hinshaw appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Carl Johnson.  Clerk LE.  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 10 days; set before Commissioner on 4/21/15 @ 845am.  $750  Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).

*Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  *No Contact w/Mary C R, Christina R or their residencesw; West Side Park or Musial Beach
961.41(1)(h)1 - Mfg/Deliv THC 2nd offense on or near a park
and witness list filed by the State
